comment: Integration by u-substitution. The main difference with respect to ~ itgsubst is that here we consider the range of ` A ( x ) ` to be in the closed interval ` ( K [,] L ) ` . If ` A ( x ) ` is a continuous, differentiable function from ` [ X , Y ] ` to ` ( Z , W ) ` , whose derivative is continuous and integrable, and ` C ( u ) ` is a continuous function on ` ( Z , W ) ` , then the integral of ` C ( u ) ` from ` K = A ( X ) ` to ` L = A ( Y ) ` is equal to the integral of ` C ( A ( x ) ) _D A ( x ) ` from ` X ` to ` Y ` . (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
